CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Languages.​Manager
CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Module
public
CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Languages.​Manager

A module to handle Languages.txt and all the language parsers within Natural Docs.

Usage

  • Call Engine.Instance.Start() which will start this module.

Constants
KeySettingsForLanguageName
public const KeySettings KeySettingsForLanguageName
KeySettingsForExtensions
public const KeySettings KeySettingsForExtensions
KeySettingsForShebangStrings
public const KeySettings KeySettingsForShebangStrings
Functions
Manager
public Manager (
Engine.Instance engineInstance
)
Dispose
protected override void Dispose (
bool strictRulesApply
)
Start
public bool Start (
Errors.ErrorList errorList
)

Loads and combines the two versions of Languages.txt, returning whether it was successful.  If there were any errors they will be added to errorList.

Dependencies

  • Config.Manager and CommentTypes.Manager must be started before using the rest of the class.

Start_AddLanguage
private bool Start_AddLanguage (
ConfigFileLanguage configFileLanguage,
Path sourceFile,
bool isSystemFile,
StringSet ignoredExtensions,
Errors.ErrorList errorList
)

A helper function that is used only by Start() to add a ConfigFileLanguage into languages.  Returns whether it was able to do so without any errors.

Start_CantDefinePropertyError
private void Start_CantDefinePropertyError (
ConfigFileLanguage configFileLanguage,
Language.LanguageType type,
Path sourceFile,
string propertyName,
Errors.ErrorList errorList
)

A helper function used only by Start() and its other helper functions which adds an error saying the passed property cannot be defined for the current language type.

Start_FixCapitalization
public void Start_FixCapitalization (
List<ConfigFileLanguage> languageList
)

A helper function used only by Start() which cleans up the capitalization of ConfigFileLanguages such as by making Alter Language entries match the original language and making Comment Type Prototype Enders match the original comment type.

Assumes languages and CommentTypes.Manager are already filled in and valid.

FromFileName
public Language FromFileName (
Path filename
)

Returns the Language associated with the passed file name, or null if none.

Note that this will not open files to search for things like shebang strings.  If the file name indicates a container language like Shebang Script, it will return that container's language information.

If the file name has no extension, it will return the language information for Shebang Script if it is defined, or null if it is not.

FromExtension
public Language FromExtension (
string extension
)

Returns the Language associated with the passed extension, or null if none.

If you pass null or an empty string, it will return the language information for Shebang Script if it is defined, or null if it is not.

FromShebangLine
public Language FromShebangLine (
string shebangLine
)

Returns the Language associated with the passed shebang line, or null if none.  Pass the entire line; this function will handle picking out the substrings.

FromName
public Language FromName (
string name
)

Returns the Language associated with the passed name or alias, or null if none.

FromID
public Language FromID (
int id
)

Returns the Language associated with the passed ID, or null if none.

Variables
languages
protected IDObjects.Manager<Language> languages

Manages all the Languages by their case-insensitive name or ID number.

aliases
protected StringTable<Language> aliases

A StringTable mapping aliases to the Languages they represent.

extensions
protected StringTable<Language> extensions

A StringTable mapping file extensions to the Languages they represent.

shebangStrings
protected SortedStringTable<Language> shebangStrings

A SortedStringTable mapping shebang strings to the Languages they represent.  Using ShebangStringComparer ensures that longer strings appear first when enumerating the entries.

predefinedLanguages
protected Language[] predefinedLanguages

An array of Languages predefined by the engine because they require special settings or objects.  These languages will not appear in the languages structure if they are not also defined in Languages.txt.
